content.question: A system consists of two gases in separate containers isolated from their surroundings, as shown. The gas on the left side of the container has a temperature <math alttext="T sub L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>L</mtext></msub></math> and the gas on the right side of the container has a greater temperature <math alttext="T sub R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext>R</mtext></msub></math>. The gases are initially separated by an insulating barrier. The barrier between the gases is then removed and the system is allowed to reach thermal equilibrium. Which of the following correctly compares the initial entropy of the system to the final entropy of the system?

choices.label: Initial entropy <math alttext="greater than" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>></mo></math> Final entropy
Initial entropy <math alttext="equals" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>=</mo></math> Final entropy
Initial entropy <math alttext="less than" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo><</mo></math> Final entropy
The comparison cannot be made without knowing the values of the initial temperatures of the gases.

content.answer: Initial entropy <math alttext="less than" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo><</mo></math> Final entropy
